channel.title: My first try at graphics EVER! - Please by nice!
channel.description:
Hey all,
Well i finally decided to open photoshop yesterday and try my hand at graphics. Opened a few tuts on this site, which were very nice btw :) but i got a bit lost :o so I just went with whatever really, haha
Tell me what you think, considering it is my first try and I'm colorblind! I know there is a lot of open space at the top, but im not sure what to put in there. I also couldn't figure out all of those gradient maps and photo filters, so if someone could explain those to me, i would be grateful
[img]http://img221.imageshack.us/img221/3939/myfirsttryly5.png[/img]
Thanks
Star

item.title: My first try at graphics EVER! - Please by nice!
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Not really a signature, but I wonder what exactly did you do to this…?
Only flaws is the non blended render and text, everything is just fine.

*Edit
You asked what gradient maps and photo filters are?
Their both adjustment layers, gradient uses a various amount of colors to pick up each detail with the different colors chosen. The photo filters brighten, darken, warm, and cool the image with solid colors.

Read full topic

With Photo Filter [/quote] they produce a better color harmony, not flow

item.title: My first try at graphics EVER! - Please by nice!
item.dc:creator: @welshy welshy
item.description:
@welshy wrote:

Hey man great start (Y) your using some nice techniques and for a beginner thats excellent work!

Some tips :

  • Use some easier to follow tutorials
  • Dont worry about gradient maps ect untill you have got a good grasp on other tools

p.s For c4ds ect goto big gfx sites

item.title: My first try at graphics EVER! - Please by nice!
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“Starblaster100, post:4, topic:130243”]Thanks!

could anyone explain to me what a C4D is? I hear lots of people talking about them but i don’t know what they are :o Google confuses me

How can i make it less pixely?

What do Gradient maps and photo filters actually do, and how do i use them?

Thanks a lot

Star[/quote]
oh nvm, when i first saw it it did now it dosent =/ weird. i like the border though too.
c4ds are like something to give flow, its like another image, you have a render, then you can have c4d.
example:
